summary: This is an email from an FBI/ NYPD task force member coordinating the stand-by plan for the arrest of Jeffrey Epstein and execution of a search warrant. It discusses logistics, notification procedures, and a potential briefing with AUSAs.

events.title: Potential AUSA Briefing
events.description: If the arrest does not happen before Monday, Assistant U.S. Attorneys (AUSAs) will be in the squad area for a briefing around noon.

events.title: Arrest Planning Coordination
events.description: An email is sent to coordinate a law enforcement team on stand-by for the imminent arrest of Jeffrey Epstein and execution of a search warrant upon his return to the U.S.

keyFacts: Law enforcement was on stand-by for the arrest of Jeffrey Epstein in early July 2019, anticipating his return to the U.S. by private flight.
Notification of the operation was expected to be short, potentially only 12-24 hours before Epstein's flight arrived.
Epstein had a history of flying into MacArthur Airport on Long Island, which was considered a potential alternative location to Teterboro for the arrest.
The email outlines a clear chain of communication for the operation, requiring recipients to confirm availability upon receiving flight information.
The document reveals coordinated planning between the FBI, NYPD, and Assistant U.S. Attorneys for a major arrest and investigation related to child exploitation and human trafficking.
